body.name: Kingslim D4 4K Dual Dash Cam with Built-in WiFi GPS, Front 4K/2.5K Rear 1080P Dual Dash Camera for Cars, 3" IPS Touchscreen 170° FOV Dashboard Camera with Sony Starvis Sensor, Support 256GB Max

asinVariationValues.variationValue: D4 4K Dash Cam Front and Rear
D4 DASH CAM WITH SD CARD

features: 4K+1080P FRONT AND REAR RECORDING - Kingslim D4 4K dual dash cam can simultaneously record videos in front Ultra HD 4K(3840*2160P) and rear FHD 1080P resolutions, which help clearly capturing license plates and road signs for your daily driving. Front wide angle of 170 degree and rear wide angle of 150 degree 6-layer glass fixed-focus lens, it gives you maximum coverage of the road and greatly enhances night vision, providing sharp and clear images and videos.

SMART DASHCAM SUPPORTS APP CONTROL - Easy to connect D4 4K dashcam with KINGSLIM APP via built in WiFi. You can playback/download videos and adjust the settings directly via phone APP（Work with Android and iOS devices). Note that exiting the APP interface during the connection process may cause the connection to fail.

AUTO RECORD GPS SPEED AND LOCATION - Built-in GPS module, auto records and save your route and driving speed in videos. It is best to turn on the GPS function in an open area in order to receive a better signal.

CLEARER NIGHT VISION - Kingslim D4 dash cam adopts the industry-leading Sony STARVIS sensor and Hisilicon processor for better image effect. Plus f/1.8 aperture and WDR technology, this dash cam can record stunning details even in low-light environments.

RELIABLE FEATURES FOR EMERGENCY RECORDS - Support G-sensor/Parking monitoring and Loop recording functions. G-sensor will automatically activate recording when the car detects impact and vibration. Parking monitor will automatically switch to parking mode after parking, and automatically turn on recording and file protection when the car is shaken or bumped. Loop recording auto rewrite the oldest videos with new, even when the SD card(NOT INCLUDED) is full the dash cam will continue recording.
body.description: 4K single front and 2.5K dual front and rear dash cam, 24 hours saving evidence and protect your car.

How do i connect dash cam to my phone? How to keep APP connected? Power on--Turn on the camera WiFi --Find out the camera wifi on your phone WLAN and then connecte it -- Open Kingslim APP, connect it with camera; Note that exiting the APP interface during the connection process may cause the connection to fail. Is it necessary to keep the car charger plugged in when using it? Yes, in case the battery dies during driving. Charging D4 dashcam with a non-original USB cable may cause power-on/off problems. If you need 24-hour power supply for parking monitoring, we recommend using hardwired kit (ASIN B0B7WLPTG1). SD card related issue? Support 16-256GB SD card. Class 10 or U3 level SD card is recommended. How to install and wiring the rear camera? KINGSLIM manuals and videos on official wedsite provide the detailed usage and installtion details. There are also many dash cam istallation related videos on video site. If you have any more questions, please connect KINGSLIM directly. Does D4 dash cam fit for my car? What's the war-ranty? Removable adhesive mount for front camera+ 7.5M long rear camera cable fit for most of vehicles likes car/ mini van /truck. Sold and shipped by Amazon, also support 24-month product warr-anty and lifetime technical su-pport from Kingslim.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well built, great quality
reviews.reviewText: This is my second dash cam with the first being an e-prance d101 which lasted 5 years before the memory card slot stopped detecting sd cards. This one feels well built and looks more sleek than my first and easier to use with the touch screen. My prior one did not come with a rear camera but now that I have it I cannot go back to just a front camera. The install was easy but I could see how it could be more difficult if you are installing the rear camera on a nicer car since you may need to make modifications to mount it on the outside. Since I drive a beater, I am not worried about wedging the cable into gaps and drilling a hole in the trunk. There is the option to stick it on the inside but you will get glare and reflection. The one minor thing I dislike is the sound it makes when clicking through the different options on the screen. It is the same sound as if you are dialing a number on your phone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good dash cam with lots of features
reviews.reviewText: After having it for about a month now, here is my opinion. First, The packaging is nice and adds an element of "high end" electronics. Inside is packed with everything one needs to install and more. There are extras in the event I want to reinstall in a different vehicle and also has the tool for tucking and hiding the wires which is a nice addition. The camera itself is very nice looking yet small enough to not create a blind spot. The rear camera is small and inconspicuous if installed correctly. I mounted the rear cam inside, on the roof looking out the back window, so it has a nice wide viewing angle. The rear cam can also be hooked up to the reverse lights so that it becomes a backup cam when the vehicle is put in reverse. The main camera feels well made and not cheap and the touch screen is very responsive giving the feel of a high end cell phone. I love the feature of just touching the right side of the screen to toggle through: Full screen main cam, Main cam with rear cam in window overlayed, rear cam with main cam in overlayed window and full screen rear cam. The video from the main cam is great quality (although I don't think it is true 4k) but still better than full 1080p hd. It clearly captures license plate numbers in front within a reasonable distance. The PC and Phone/tablet apps are nicely laid out with both the video and GPS map. Although I can't get them to synchronise on any of my computers, tablets or phones, and one of my computers is a custom built recording studio computer that has massive amounts of RAM and storage that runs in Mac or P.C. and still can't get the video to play smoothly or synchronize with the gps. So I definitely think that the apps still need work to speed them up. I can, however, get the videos to play smoothly if I open them up as just a video without GPS using a video playing app. If I had to pick 1 thing I don't like and/or needs to be redesigned, It would be the release button. I can't and don't leave the cam in my car when I'm parked due to the heat. Just going to the store and home for a total of about 30 minutes heats this thing up so much that It is actually too hot to touch. Given the ridiculously hot summer this has been, I don't know if it's only the heat from the sun or a combination of sun and operating temp. So, Every time I get home, I remove the cam from the bracket using the release button and it is a major pain in the @$$. I know exactly where the button is, as I can feel it, but I still spend 5 or 10 minutes trying to get the camera to release from the mounting bracket. It should definitely have the button on the front somewhere or a much larger release mechanism. Due to the type of car, the angle of my windshield and the very limited space in my car, reaching the windshield just below my rear view mirror is quite difficult, and made harder by the steering wheel pressing into my chest and the fact that I have to fight with the camera just to get it off without ripping the entire mount off the glass in this heat is enough to make me pretty irritable. Also, I know that people leave it in their car at night because it will record any disturbances to the vehicle but if some one is going to break into a vehicle to steal anything worth money, they are probably going to grab this camera first, defeating the purpose of it being there in the first place. Having said that about the release button, I still do like this cam and think it is worth the price and would highly recommend it to anyone. It is for this reason and because all the pro's out weigh the 1 con that I still give it a 5 star rating.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Everything works great, I loved how compact and easy to install it is. The video quality is very clear and detailed. The only thing I'm not satisfied with is the fact that I can't access the videos through the app when I'm outside the car. The only way I can access the videos is when I use the app inside the car.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Unreliable and Unstable, but Great Customer Service
reviews.reviewText: Updated Review:So, I was contacted by a customer service rep as a result of my review and the customer service I received was excellent. For that alone, I’ve updated my review and stars. She was kind, prompt, and rectified the situation by sending me a replacement device.I’ve installed it today and so far it is working fine. However, only time will truly tell because in the beginning, my original one was incredible too! I just hope this one stands the test of time. Hopefully I’ll be back after some time to update my review to 5 stars.Original Review:The video quality of the camera is fantastic…when it works. I’m actually quite bummed that I took this long to write a review because every time I thought about writing one, it would function somewhat normally again and I’d forget about writing a review. But now it almost never works normally that I’m finally coming around to writing the review I should’ve actually written 1.5 years ago.So, the product actually had power issues even from the very first month I had this. It wasn’t too frequent, but it would happen at least once a week. The power wouldn’t automatically come on with the car and I’d have to manually press on the power button to get it powered up. Then, it would be fine. If this was the only issue now, I’d still just make do with what works.Then, as the months progressed, the power issue happened more frequently. Until, eventually, my rearview camera stopped working entirely. It isn’t a black screen, or anything that indicates a broken camera. It literally just has no input into the main body. I’ve attempted to take out and plug back in the rearview camera jack, and there’s no change on the screen. It is fixed on the front view camera only. So now my rearview camera is useless with power issues still happening.Finally, what’s happening now is that it almost never powers on with the car. I actually will get power maybe once or twice a week. The issue now though is that it won’t even turn on when I press on the power button to reboot it. So I’m not sure if it’s even functional now.I just don’t get how this is possible. 2 years is really not too long of use for this type of technology. And I understand if the response and feedback eventually slows down due to memory and such, but to have it be almost dead most of the time even with active power input? That’s an indication of a poor quality item especially in the times we’re living in.I’m not sure if all hope is lost at this point, but I hope there is some sort of solution or rectifying the situation on the seller’s part, to which I’d gladly edit or update the review. Otherwise, do not purchase Kingslim products. They’re not worth your business.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Quality and Easy to Install
reviews.reviewText: This camera combo was incredibly easy to setup, at around 2 hours from unbox to all wires ran and on the road. Video quality is great! App needs a little work, but gets the job done.

reviews.reviewText: very good camera and I very happy for this purchase. The quality of the movies is very good and it is excellent that I can to download the movie by wifi to the smartphone.
